system.description:
Starting at 1st level your artifact attempts to tempt you into particular actions. Work with your narrator to decide upon this temptation, or select one of the following temptations:

  • Let the artifact feast on your vitality: spend half of your total hit dice (rounded up).

  • Let the artifact take control: you are compelled to take a certain action during the next minute, to the best of your ability, determined by the narrator.

  • Give into the rage: for the next minute, you must kill all other creatures to the best of your abilities, and you must seek out and target allies if no enemies are present.

You can choose to give into your artifact’s temptation at any time during your turn without the use of an action.

Whenever you give into your artifact’s temptation, you immediately gain a number of artifact charges equal to twice your proficiency bonus. Any artifact charges in excess of your normal charge limit are lost at the end of your turn.

Whenever you make a saving throw, if you haven’t given into your artifact’s temptation since finishing your last long rest, you may gain an expertise die on that saving throw as a reaction.
